definition: to drown/to indulge/addicted to/to spoil (a child)
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)

sentences.english: The same goes for other coddling behaviors, like pestering him to eat his vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 对于其它的溺爱也如法炮制，如劝他自己吃菜。

sentences.english: Grandmother dotes on her the twins.
Now I, his coddled son, get to dick around on the Internet all day.
sentences.chinese: 现在，他溺爱的孙子，我，才得以网络上混口饭吃。

sentences.english: Mr Grant dotes on his granddaughter. She's the apple of his eye.
sentences.chinese: 格兰特先生很溺爱他的小孙女，她是他的掌上明珠。

sentences.english: The first one is parents’ blind pampering of children.
sentences.chinese: 第一个是父母对于孩子的盲目溺爱。

sentences.english: Ramadan would spend summers there, doting on the locals, he adds.
sentences.chinese: 他补充说，拉马丹将有花，夏季，当地人溺爱。

sentences.english: John lavishes care on his only son.
sentences.chinese: 约翰对他的独生儿子过分溺爱。

sentences.english: It's just a small operation, I cant mollycoddle myself, life must go on!
sentences.chinese: 只是一个小手术，我不能溺爱自己，生活还要继续。

sentences.english: His mother was doting and easygoing.
sentences.chinese: 老盖茨的母亲对孩子比较溺爱，为人非常随和。

sentences.english: She had been cosseted by her parents all during her childhood.
sentences.chinese: 她小时候一直为父母所溺爱。

sentences.english: Parents who dote on their only child.
Despite the fact that she is the only child in her family, she is never babied by her parents.
sentences.chinese: 尽管她是家里的独生女，她父母也从不溺爱她。

sentences.english: Overindulgent people will cause disruptions in your life.
sentences.chinese: 溺爱会给你的生活带来分裂。

sentences.english: The parents look after to add to them for this, their is inebriated to spoil in.
sentences.chinese: 父母为此对他们照顾有加，他们沈醉于溺爱之中。

sentences.english: This type of parent is similar to the " doting " parent, but also different.
sentences.chinese: 这种家长和溺爱型有点类似，但又不同。

sentences.english: Zhou Jianwei with mother spoil love grow up, develop aggressive personality.
sentences.chinese: 周健伟在母亲的溺爱呵护下长大，养成好胜的性格。

definition: to spoil/to indulge sb (usu. a child)
